intro: Ageratina glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in dense clusters, often surrounded by bracts that give it a fluffy appearance. Its leaves are typically hairy and glandular, contributing to its common name. Ageratina glandulifera is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive blooms and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
